question_text: What is BIOS corruption and what are the typical symptoms and solutions?
answer_options: Software virus infection - run antivirus scan and update operating system
Firmware becomes damaged preventing proper startup - symptoms include no display, continuous beeping, boot loops
Hard drive failure causing slow boot times - replace storage device
Memory error causing random crashes - run memory diagnostic tests
correct_answer: Firmware becomes damaged preventing proper startup - symptoms include no display, continuous beeping, boot loops
explanation: BIOS corruption occurs when the firmware becomes damaged or corrupted, preventing proper system startup. Symptoms include: no display output, continuous beeping, failure to POST, or boot loops. Solutions: BIOS reset via jumper, CMOS battery removal, BIOS recovery mode, or BIOS chip replacement in severe cases.
